title: B18 Walter Johnson Brown Pennants  SOLD!!!
author: rdwyer

posts.post_title: B18 Walter Johnson Brown Pennants  SOLD!!!
posts.post_content: Hard to price this.  I'm thinking $50.  Make a honest offer, and I'll probably let you have it.

Is 30 too low? Not trying to be insulting, but its tough to gauge value on it in that condition. If I'm too low, I totally understand

Ed
You got it.  See was that hard?  :)

[quote name="Ed_Hutchinson" post=1643726]Is 30 too low? Not trying to be insulting, but its tough to gauge value on it in that condition. If I'm too low, I totally understand

Ed[/QUOTE]

Not trying to butt in on someone else's sale but I don't think that's insulting. I bought a Johnson B18 last year for $60 or so and it didn't have the coloring issues this one has. Not saying that someone wouldn't pay $50 or more but I don't think your offer is insulting. Nonetheless, getting any WaJo item under $100 is a steal in my book!

I love this. Too often buyers are sheepish in offering what they are willing to pay, so as to not be insulted by the seller. Sellers are often insulted by buyers who don't offer what they believe they should.

It's nice to see buyers and sellers play nice, like this. If the offer is too low, a simple "No thanks" will suffice from the seller.

:D

[quote name="Stampsfan" post=1644248]I love this. Too often buyers are sheepish in offering what they are willing to pay, so as to not be insulted by the seller. Sellers are often insulted by buyers who don't offer what they believe they should.

It's nice to see buyers and sellers play nice, like this. If the offer is too low, a simple "No thanks" will suffice from the seller.

:D[/QUOTE]

100% agree...I never understood why people get butt hurt over trivial things like a low offer.  It's definitely nice to see a transaction go down like this :)
